attributes.action: Don't Raise Income Tax to pay for NHS - Find Alternative Source of Funds
attributes.background: Research has suggested that income tax may have to rise, by as much as £2,000 per household, to meet the future needs of the NHS. This would be unacceptable when the public is struggling to even scrape by.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until it’s simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Refund the application fee for all unsuccessful British Citizenship applications
attributes.background: As a single mother, I used my life savings to apply for British application of myself and my daughter. I denied myself of basic necessities. The Home Office refused our application and took the whole money. I can’t stop thinking about it, this has led to depression and insomnia.
attributes.additional_details: A small admin fee would be reasonable for them to keep, but not the whole fee.

attributes.action: Repeal Section 127 (1) of the 2003 Communications Act. Offence is not a crime.
attributes.background:
The Communications Act states: (1) A person is guilty of an offence if he 
(a) sends by means of a public electronic communications network a message or other matter that is GROSSLY OFFENSIVE or of an indecent, obscene or menacing character.
attributes.additional_details: Clearly, this is in breach of everybody's right to Freedom of Speech. Offence is an entirely subjective concept. For the state to be able to decide what is offensive, and then prosecute accordingly is tyrannical.

attributes.action: Change the gcse scheme back to A,B,C instead of grades 9-1 so it’s easier
attributes.background: The students currently about to take GCSEs have been studying from year 7 up to get an A+ or etc all of a sudden the mark scheme has been changed which is not fair. The government have made it too hard for them to achieve in such small time.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it easier so more students are able to be more successful in life. Changing the grading scheme has not made it only harder for children to be more successful but has also put more stress on them as the government had only changed it recently.

attributes.action: Let the general public have a vote on military action in Syria.
attributes.background: Let the public vote on military action in syria. Let us have a say on how our military should be used, not just government.
attributes.additional_details: With tensions rising in Syria it's important to protect our military from going into another war in the middle east.

attributes.action: Outlaw the use of gas gun type bird scarers.  They dont work and are a nuisance
attributes.background:
Gas gun type bird scarers are used by farmers to scare birds from their crops.
They periodically make a series of loud bangs to scare the birds.
The loud bang also scares passers by, horse and dogs.
The birds return after a few minutes making them ineffective and a nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
There do not appear to be any statutory restrictions on the the use of gas guns but the NFU has guidelines on their use:- https://www.nfuonline.com/assets/4662

The guidelines are largely ignored, the gas guns are inevitably plonked in a field and forgotten about.
Their proliferation has made the countryside sound like a battlefield.

Given how ineffective they are and the number of them that are thoughtlessly deployed (too many for local authority control). They should be outlawed.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: Subsidy on "free from" products for people with food allergies
attributes.background: After having a child who is food intolerant to several things including dairy, wheat and fish & meeting several people in similar positions who all struggle to get anything on prescription, I want to petition for the Government to provide a subsidy for these expensive but necessary items.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Amend the Town and Country Planning Regulations on the flying of the EU flag
attributes.background: Under the 2007/2012 Planning Regulations flags can be flown without consent. Schedule 1 Class H allows: The flag of the Commonwealth, EU, UN, or any other international organisation of which the UK is a member. On 29/3/2019 the UK will leave the EU, hence flying the EU flag without consent must end.
attributes.additional_details:
The Town and Country Planning Regulations 2007 and amendment 2012, allows certain flags can be flown without consent, as set out within Schedule 1, Class H. 
One of these flags, the EU flag,  can be flown because it is a flag of an international organisation of which the UK is a member. From 29th March 2019 this will no longer be the case. Therefore, in future consent must be required.
The government’s guidance in “Flying flags: a plain English guide” must also be updated to reflect this change.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Amend Highways act 1980 to allow electric powered motorcycles to use motorways
attributes.background: Recent developments have created high powered electric motorcycles, but as they do not have an engine with a capacity exceeding 50cc they are excluded from motorway travel. I propose that the Highways Act be amended to change the wording defining a motorcycle by power output not by engine capacity.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways act 1980 schedule 4 Classes of Traffic for Purposes of Special Roads
The Motorways traffic (England and wales) Regulations 1982

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT+ education to the primary curriculum in schools
attributes.background:
One of the reasons homophobia is still widespread is due to lack of education and understanding. To reverse this, and create a more accepting and less hating society for the future I want to petition for children to be educated.
Just as racism, sexism and other issues ARE issues, this is a HUGE one
attributes.additional_details:
Homophobia - the act of hatred from minor to extreme levels towards people who prefer the same gender
Impacts -
more hate crimes, tragedies, killings and more, just for something someone cant change and which is not abnormal, a "sin" or any other sort
Evidence -
You dont need me to state. Recall some memories when you were a child.Look at the messed up world.Look at the different LGBT rights in areas. Not many places have equal rights yet at ALL.
Speak up and SIGN this petition for EQUALITY

attributes.action: Make all companies provide an e mail address as a point of contact
attributes.background: Received a letter from Sky and tried to ring this morning  -  automated service had no option to cancel for my reason! - cut off, tried chat, more than half an hour no one came on to chat - at least an hour of my time wasted! I have a life!
attributes.additional_details: This issue does not just apply to Sky it applies to many big companies, people do not have the time to hang on phone lines for lengthy times due to insufficient staff, or to wait to speak to customer service on line.  Often the problem could be put in an e mail and sent, then the customer just waits for a reply instead of getting frustrated and angry waiting on phone lines.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Give nurses a better pay deal
attributes.background: Many nurses have been misled over how much they would receive as the result of the recent pay deal. Nurses had been told that they would get  least an immediate 3% pay rise but this is not what happened.
attributes.additional_details: Nurses were expecting a long-awaited and well-deserved pay rise but instead have been left disappointed and out of pocket.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the Membership of NATO.
attributes.background: The British public should have an opportunity to determine whether the country should play a role in the future in the The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
attributes.additional_details: NATO was founded in 1949 by the United States as a military alliance between western nations to oppose the Soviet Union and serve a purpose in defending the west against the eastern block. However, today NATO is now a cold war relic. Britain should take control over its military affairs and its foreign policy to prevent the country from getting involved in wars.  We should follow our own operations rather than following NATO.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Freeze Rent / Mortgage payments for poorly people who are not be fit to work.
attributes.background: People are getting evicted from their homes due to not being able to afford their rent / mortgage payments when they have a serious illness such as cancer. Sometimes benefits won't cover the mortgage / rent payments.
attributes.additional_details: Help sick people to stay in their homes by covering their rent payments in full through benefits or if they have a mortgage then freeze their payments until they are fit to return to work.

attributes.action: To set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95% LTV
attributes.background: I would like call upon the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95 -98 % LTV mortgages to tenants who have been renting for 36 months or more to be able to obtain a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 3,700 homes are standing empty in Leicester and Leicestershire.
Latest figures obtained by the BBC show that 1,336 homes are unoccupied in the city and a further 2,372 around the county are also currently not lived in.
A further 183 in Rutland are also empty.
We have also become a nation of renters, with rents higher then some mortgage payments, tenants should be able to buy on the open market esp First time Home buyers.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to state pension age back to 65 for men and 60 for women
attributes.background: I started paying into the N.I. system aged 16 when the retirement age was stated as 65 for men and 60 for women. I’ve been full time employed since then and have had the terms of the state pension age changed without consultation. Stand up and stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Look at the gov.uk website for the state pension change and what it means to you. You can get a personal projection so you can see how this new scheme will affect you personally.

attributes.action: To legally stagger school holidays in each county in England
attributes.background: The current holiday system for schools forces holiday prices up very high in current school hols as all parents want holidays at similar times. Spreading this demand out by schools having different weeks off would lower prices for families but shouldn’t affect holiday companies profit. Help!!
attributes.additional_details: This is an ongoing issue known by everyone. I think rather than sitting back and letting families struggle for years to take their kids away something should be done. It’s not feasible to ask holiday companies to change prices without demand changing and the only way that can change is the government changing school holidays in England. Help families. Don’t just accept how it is!!

attributes.action: To cap tax and national insurance on wages.
attributes.background:
There should be a cap on how many hours you should get taxed and insuranced on.
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesn’t make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you don’t receive any extra.
attributes.additional_details:
If you work under 22 hours get get tax free but if you work more you get taxed.
It doesn’t make sense the more hours you work the more tax you pay. As a person you don’t receive any extra.I believe there should be a cap on how much tax and national insurance should be taken from your wages. If you work more then 45-50 hours a week, what you do  over should be tax and national insurance free. Personally I work 60-70 hour weeks and get tax an extortionate amount. Which works out I work 15-20 hours free because that’s how much goes to the groverment.
There should be a cap on tax and national insurance to make it fair for all those people that work those extra hours.

attributes.action: Equal rights for Fathers-to-be to be paid leave for antenatal appointments.
attributes.background: In a society where equal rights matter, I believe Fathers-to-be should be allowed the same right as the Mother-to-be. This is the right of paid time off for antenatal care, of which equally includes antenatal or parenting classes if they’ve been recommended by a doctor or midwife.
attributes.additional_details:
Statutory Paternity Pay and Leave: employer guide:-
https://www.gov.uk/employers-paternity-pay-leave

Pregnant employees' rights:-
https://www.gov.uk/working-when-pregnant-your-rights

Equality Act 2010:-
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/equality-act-2010-guidance

attributes.action: Mandatory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth Workers
attributes.background: Compulsory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth workers will ensure that leaders know what to do if a young person is experiencing a mental health crisis. By recognising the signs early and knowing what to do in each circumstance, leaders can create greater safety for young people.
attributes.additional_details: If a young person grazes their knee, or breaks their ankle while on a residential, noticing the symptoms and treating the problem can be simple for a first aider. If a mental health crisis occurs, the issue may be troublesome to overcome if a leader is not trained in mental health first aid. 1 in 10 young people experience a mental health issue at a given time (https://mhfaengland.org/individuals/youth/) yet the subject is still stigmatised and brushed under the carpet. https://mhfaengland.org/

attributes.action: Establish Compulsory Mental Health & Wellbeing Workshops for Secondary Schools
attributes.background: To date, there has been a marked increase in youth related depression and suicide. Taboos against mental health confound public acceptance of mental health issues. This petition aims to address this, starting with the introduction of compulsory mental health workshops to secondary education.
attributes.additional_details:
Sources:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing/adhocs/006721childrensmentalillhealthbytimespentonsocialnetworkingsitesuk2013to2014

https://www.time-to-change.org.uk/blog/why-mental-illness-regarded-taboo-compared-physical-illness

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2009/feb/20/mental-health-taboo

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/millennials-uk-mental-health-depression-world-ranking-second-worst-study-anxiety-a7572026.html

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Parliament to set aside time to debate the rules whereby MPs put forward bills
attributes.background: Following the wrecking of two bills which had received extensive scrutiny by departments, and were supported by ministers, by a single MP calling "object" on a Friday afternoon, time should be set aside by Parliament to consider and amend the rules whereby MPs can introduce bills to the House.
attributes.additional_details: A single MP is currently able to wreck private members' bills by talking them out, or objecting.

attributes.action: The government should give every citizen,young and old,a fresh fruit/veg voucher
attributes.background: The government should give every citizen, young and old, a fresh fruit/veg voucher EACH WEEK to the sum of £25 and this amount should be raised by taxing unhealthy food.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing more to encourage people to eat more fresh fruit/veg. This can be easily achieved if all the population, young and old, are given an amount each week so spend solely on this produce. The money required could be raised by the government by raising tax on unhealthy food.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for urinals to have a partition that offers privacy
attributes.background: Urinating and exposing yourself in a public toilet is an uncomfortable situation at the best of times. It's time a privacy partition is installed in all toilets across the country, and give us the privacy we deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Just because we can urinate in public, does not mean we like exposing ourselves.

Nearly 4 million people in the UK are affected by paruresis or shy bladder syndrome, which can be a physically and socially uncomfortable condition. 
 
We need to make it a legal requirement for all urinals across the country to have decent privacy and help people conquer toilet anxiety.

attributes.action: Add "None of the above" to the election ballot paper.
attributes.background: With belief in MP's of all parties at an all time low, add "None of the above" to the ballot paper to remove all candidates in a constituency from standing in elections for 10 years. this may make candidates, MP's and parties more respectful and responsive to the electorate in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details: If "None of the above" wins the ballot then all those candidate on the ballot paper would be barred from standing for office for 10 years

attributes.action: Impose a maximum booking fee on online cinema ticket purchases.
attributes.background: Some cinemas can charge upwards of £1.75 on top of the price of a ticket just to book it online instead of at the cinema which is blatantly extortionate. A reasonable cap either as a fixed amount or as a percentage of the ticket price should be imposed.

attributes.action: Revamp the House of Lords to only 400 members all of whom are Life Peers.
attributes.background: The House of Lords has become far too large for its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Chinese government has a bigger second chamber than the UK - which is absurd. The House of Lords no longer represents its national needs.

attributes.action: 2 year prison sentence for carrying knives
attributes.background: Too many of our young bright teenagers are dying needlessly on a daily basis, robbing parents of their children and brothers and sisters losing a loved one. Far too many teenagers are carrying knives, who's only use is for causing injury or death.
attributes.additional_details: Please look at the news every day to see that knife crime is getting out of control, and the government appear to be too weak to take the action necessary to reduce/stop this. Carrying a knife should mean a mandatory 2 year minimum prison term

attributes.action: Give equal survivor pension benefits to widows and widowers of female teachers.
attributes.background: Men and women have always paid equal contributions into the teachers' pension scheme. However, widowers of women teachers continue to receive lower amounts than widows of men teachers. The DfE recently announced that spouses / civil partners of same-sex couples will receive equal benefits to widows.
attributes.additional_details:
The bereaved spouses of teachers receive different levels of pension benefits, depending on gender and sexual orientation. Men married to women are disadvantaged compared to those in all other legal relationships. Survivors receive 50% of their partner's pension accrued since 1972. However, only contributions since 1988 count towards survivor benefits for the husbands of female teachers. 
See: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/occupational-pension-schemes-review-of-survivor-benefits

attributes.action: Provide free legal aid for those on low incomes and benefits
attributes.background: Some of the poorest families in England and Wales are being denied legal aid because they cannot afford the financial contributions they are required to make, This is a travesty and totally unfair sign this petition to give justice to the poorest in our society. Give them free access to lawyers.
attributes.additional_details:
A study commissioned by the body that represents solicitors criticised the fact that many on low incomes are being deprived of access to justice by the very system that is supposed to support them.

The report, titled Priced out of Justice?, looked at means testing regulations which control  and how applicants resisting eviction from their homes, for example, are unable to obtain legal representation.

How can this be happening in a modern day democracy. Its reminiscent of the 18th and 19th C

attributes.action: Require 5-year warranty on electrical goods to reduce environmental impact
attributes.background: White goods, TVs and other electrical items often break shortly after their warranty has expired and are often not economically viable to repair. Manufacturers should have to take greater care to ensure these items are better quality and fit for use for many years to reduce the environmental impact.

attributes.action: Government should continue annual  breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.background: Current Breast cancer follow-up includes yearly mammogram with breast examination with a breast surgeon and request additional tests for 5 years. NHS has now started implementing new open access (stratified) follow up pathway with no  annual breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.additional_details: Patients will only have a mammogram and no breast examination by surgeon.Ladies has to rely on their own examination skills, which is very dangerous.This will risk patients lives. Mammograms are not sensitive and needs to be complemented by breast examination and other investigations +_ tissue sampling.Govt should continue annual mandatory breast examinations  by breast surgeon and stop implementing this dangerous stratified followup pathway.

attributes.action: Start supplementing milk with Vitamin D.
attributes.background: Many countries supplement their milk supply with vitamin d and the UK which rarely gets sunshine does not.
attributes.additional_details: There has been evidence showing that many in the UK suffer from vitamin d deficiencies.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Make A levels 3 years. This is to avoid psychological stress for young people.
attributes.background: Governments should take initiative to create this legislation as it would decrease psychological stress for young people.The psychological health of the youth is worrying with many dropping out and wanting to end their lives. We need to support the youth to create a more skilled workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
Today several aspects of young people’s quality of life and lack of well-being in this latest update has increased with over 42 .2% of 16-
19 year old experiencing anxiety which in many cases relates to education. 231 people committed suicide in 2017 due to exam stress while many other attempted to take their own life. We need to help our youth as these are the people of tomorrow. All life is precious so it must be safeguarded by us the people.
